reviews.sentence: Cute hotel. Great location walking distance to the mall and close enough to the bars on 4th and 5th. Cute hotel decor is nice. Beds are fulls not queens only downside.
Great hotel and location I would just warn people of the street noise. Not sure if there are room locations away from the street but you should request this if you stay.

Perfect Downtown Sopt. I stayed at the Bristol Hotel in June 2015 for one night at the start of a two week trip to the US. We arrived in the evening to a very helpful staff member on reception who made us feel very welcome. My husband and I stayed in a street facing two doubles room whilst my grandmother stayed across the corridor in a superior king. Both rooms were clean comfortable well decorated and well appointed. We did not find street noise to be an issue although we were on a higher floor and very tired after a non stop flight from London so probably could have slept on the street and been undisturbed. The hotel offers free wifi and this was a good speed. The hotel is very conveniently located for downtown and the Gaslamp as well as the harbour. There is a 71 just around the corner which is very useful for stocking up on essentials as the water in the room is 6 a bottle. The parking onsite is valet and cost around 30 a night. San Diego is a beautiful city and I would happily have stayed at the Bristol for longer to explore more.

Good but could be great if they improve F. B The hotel has a great location on 1st avenue. You can walk to the Marina and to tons of restaurants and bars. Also a shopping mall is 5 minutes walking. The room is big and very comfortable. The staff is super friendly. They only need to improve their food and beverage. Menu is very limited and not good at all. Other than that is a great hotel. Wifi signal very good by the way.

a San Diego Native Review. really nice location. we normally stay at the US Grant but this weekend it was nt in the budget so we stayed at the Bristol it was great. our friends were at the Grant and we were just 3 blocks from them so everywhere we needed to be was a short walk. i would stay here again. My husband and i wondered about the earplugs on the night stand we discovered its because of the street noise if you re a light sleeper you do nt want to be on the street side. location location location. and the bed was comfortable but i felt like there should have been a comforter but it was comfortable nonetheless. totally central. we were with a group based at the US Grant walking 3 blocks to meet up there was easy all the fun of downtown just as easy. i d love a big fluffy comforter.

I stopped by the hotel the night before our check in date. I was surprising my gf with a special night out and wanted to see if what could be done to spice up the visit. Pinal i hope i remember it right from istanbul was the amazing young woman who helped me out and she was able to upgrade our experience and give us a room that is truly remarkable. We do nt drink so champagne was nt necessary although it was offered. And the room on the top floor was just to cherry on top of a quite wonderful experience. Clean amenities comfy setting hospitality on point. The parkin for 23 a night is steep 16 if you have hybrid. so i just parked up the road fo free. Anyhow. If there s a deal on this hotel and i need to stay downtown. i m jumping on it. Great service. Piano to play if you can in the lobby which i always love and decent location if you need to be downtown.
Great downtown location the FRIENDLIEST STAFF. Very helpful front desk friendly staff clean large rooms. Great downtown location for walking or transit.

Perfect location in buzzing Gaslamp District. Excellent location and the room was really light and fresh. First time in San Diego and we would highly recommend staying here. We walked everywhere from the hotel and the area around at night was really buzzing.
Highly recommend. Gorgeous hotel helpful staff great location. Highly recommend.
Great location in downtown San DiegoWalking distance to Petco Field the harbor No bar.

The Bristol. Wow. Amazing property. I loved the modern decor and the welcoming staff. Our room was perfect with an amazing view 907The bed was plush and so cozy. The only complaint would be the restroom being so close to the bed and toilet placement. My husband and I stayed Friday to Sunday. This place is ideal for Gas Lamp shenanigans. Most people complain about the expensive parking but really this is the perfect location to walk mostly anywhere so normally I was freaked out about this fee since almost all the reviews complain about it. But TRUST me its worth it. Steps from Horton Plaza and a ton of good eats cheap and expensive alike. Cofe Cap Machine in the Lobby was awesome. I met one of the staff members asking about where to thrift in the area and she was AWESOME her name is Hope. She really needs a place at the front desk wink wink. We were with a group of people that were in and out and the Hotel was very accommodating to our event. My husbands Bike broke down and the parking attendants and maintenance staff were very helpful and even offered to help jump start his bike. After all the trips to the parts store to fix the dead battery we ended up staying there until 8 pm when check out was 11 am. The staff was very friendly during our crisis with the dead battery. I would stay here again with or without my kids.

Cutest boutique hotel nestled in the heart of San Diego. This hotel was a delightful surprise. could not believe the affordable rates for this cute lil resort like boutique hotel downtown San Diego. Love the modern updated style that makes this homey comfy and unique. Staff were amazing in accommodating our organizations annual retreat with conference room and meals. Parking on site with half price for hybrid vehicles. What a wonderful place will definitely recommend to all our friends.

OK place but there are many better in San Diego. Its an OK place but there are so many really nice places in downtown San Diego why bother with just OK. Having to provide ID for all guests is beyond the pale. They provide free earplugs because the trams are quite noisy and just outside the rooms. No option for durable cups for coffee in the lounge. So if you want coffee chop down a tree and add to the landfill. In room the have durables. No news paper in the room or lounge. but they do have a tablet in the room. Good for internet and of course also for spying on you.

OK place but there are many better in San Diego. Its an OK place but there are so many really nice places in downtown San Diego why bother with just OK. Having to provide ID for all guests is beyond the pale. They provide free earplugs because the trams are quite noisy and just outside the rooms. No option for durable cups for coffee in the lounge. So if you want coffee chop down a tree and add to the landfill. In room the have durables. No news paper in the room or lounge. but they do have a tablet in the room. Good for internet and of course also for spying on you.

Great service and room loud area. Hotel was nice clean and staff was friendly. Only downside was the location very loud lots of police sirens going off at night you re across the street from the fire station and police. Overall i would stay here again and use the ear plugs they provide in your room.

Lack of facilities but good location. Situated in a convenient location comfy beds. The provided ear plugs on the bedside cabinet were a bit of a give away. Even on the top floor the early morning noise from the bin emptying nearby construction site was intrusive. Lack of facilities in the so called hotel no bar or restaurant or room service.
Exceptional. Clean comfortable and friendly. Location a bit of a walk.
Good. overall good experience. short distance to here and there. close to trolley stationsat time police car sirens.

Very sad place to book at. Be careful the room we had was terribly dirty and very noisy. The customer service at this hotel is one that does not care about you whatsoever. I would not recommend this location to my worst enemy.
San Diego and Covid 19. The room is nicely laid out big and comfortable. The tram noise and the time it takes to get the hot water in the shower.

Bristil Hotel during COVID19 Mayhem. This is a lovely hotel with very comfortable and spacious romsthe only downside were the noisy trams which made sleeping at time very difficult we understood why the hotel supplied us with ear plugs. Other than that and COVID19 madness we enjoyed our stay and would consider coming back in the future.
